meanings.definition: One who needles or provokes others.
meanings.sent1: The needler in the group always teased his friends playfully.
meanings.sent2: The needler enjoyed getting a reaction out of people by making fun of them.
meanings.sent3: The needler's jokes were so silly that everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a needler, always finding ways to annoy her.
meanings.sent5: The needler's mischievous grin gave away his intention to provoke.

meanings.definition: A small, sharp tool used for sewing or embroidery.
meanings.sent1: She carefully threaded the needle of the needler before starting to sew.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used a needler to create intricate designs on the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The needler slipped from her fingers and pricked her thumb.
meanings.sent4: The needler glinted in the sunlight as she worked on her embroidery.
meanings.sent5: The needler's sharp point made it easy to pierce through the fabric.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that irritates or annoys.
meanings.sent1: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was a real needler during the night.
meanings.sent2: Her little sister was a needler, always asking annoying questions.
meanings.sent3: The needler of a neighbor's barking dog kept her up all night.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet was a needler, driving her crazy with its rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The needler of a scratchy tag in her shirt bothered her all day long.
